title: Spindrift Cellars 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Though designated a reserve, nothing really sets this apart from other Spindrift Pinot Noirs, other than a slight increase in price. Black cherry fruit, a streak of cola, and a suggestion of cold coffee come through. It's drinking well and should be consumed over the near term.

title: Ste Michelle Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine has a throwback label celebrating Chateau Ste Michelle's 50th anniversary. Upfront aromas of clarified butter, peach and spice are followed by medium-bodied stone fruit flavors. It's a varietal crowd-pleaser.

title: Tenuta Casaletti 2014  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
description: Aromas of red plum, baking spice and white pepper set the tone while the savory palate delivers raspberry jam, clove and tobacco. It's already accessible and easygoing, with polished tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Tenuta Santa Maria 2015  Valpolicella Ripasso
description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, tilled soil and cooking spice lead the way while the dense palate evokes prune, cocoa and a touch of cinnamon. Supple tannins provide the lithe framework.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2016 Private Collection Estate Bottled Qualitätswein Riesling (Mosel)
description: Zesty lemon-lime acidity and succulent peach and pineapple flavors collide in this easy-sipping, off-dry Riesling. Light-footed and fruity, it's not a complex wine but widely appealing. Drink now.

title: Trivento 2014 Golden Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: This wine's dark, rooty black fruit aromas are more cool and earthy than bright. In the mouth, it's dense and sort of flat. That theme is echoed in its flavors, which recall prune, chocolate and mocha. It finishes with heavy berry notes and not many subtleties.

title: Truchard 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a tart lively wine complex in forest floor, black tea and tangy flavors of cranberry, rhubarb and strawberry. It retains a medium-bodied weight that gives it breadth.

title: Trunk Up Wines 2014 Red (Napa Valley)
description: From grapes grown in Carneros and Oak Knoll, this wine combines nearly equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Franc, with smaller amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Tart and tannic, it offers structure and a lightness of oak around old-school elements of red currant and cedar.

title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2016 My Karp Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Earth and herbal notes fade with aeration, exposing prettier notes of honeydew, grapefruit and peach. Brisk acidity and plump, juicy stone-fruit notes lengthen a fresh, honey-glazed finish. Drink now.

title: Xanadu 2015 Chardonnay (Margaret River)
description: This is a toasty, smokey, nutty and slightly peachy Chardonnay from Margaret River. The palate is rich, with a viscous texture and balanced acidity, but the oak is a little prominent on the finish.

title: Xanadu 2017 DJL Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This wine bursts with mango, peach and passionfruit, with a touch of cut grass. There's plenty of tongue-tingling acidity on the palate and some textural weight, likely from the Sémillon.

title: Brunelli 2015 Corte Cariano Corvina (Veronese)
description: Made entirely with dried Corvina grapes, this has aromas of red currant, toast and a touch of eucalyptus. The medium-bodied palate shows black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Camille Paquet 2016 Le Mont  (Mâcon Solutré)
description: Produced in vineyards close to the rock of Solutré in the southern Maconnais, this wine is rich with a strong mineral content and a rounded texture. Its texture is still young and tight although it will open up as it matures over the next few months, until mid-2018. At that time, enjoy the richness and the ripe white stone-fruit flavors.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2015  Chambolle-Musigny
description: This bright, fruity wine has good acidity as well as red-cherry fruitiness. Its crisp texture supports the potential of the ripe fruits. Drink from 2020.

title: Chateau Rongzi 2012 Blue Label Red (China)
description: Dark ruby in color, this wine has a nose of cherry and sage. It is soft on entry, offering flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, Mediterranean herbs and bacon. Tannins slowly build on the palate, lasting into a bright finish that is punctuated by a touch of smoke.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's aromas are a bit reticent, which is unusual for this variety, with slate, lime and white peach notes. The palate is more generous, with off-dry, lightly spritzy stone fruit flavors. There are some good things going on, but they don't quite come together. Some additional time in bottle may help.

title: Croma Vera 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Dense black plums, crushed black rocks and a dollop of vanilla, star anise and licorice show on the rather rich nose of this bottling. The flavors are a tad woody, with cigar box quite prominent, as well as roasted game and dark minty cherries.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2014 Griffin's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Juicy black cherry fruit is set against dark mocha, licorice and smoke notes in this wine. There's a slight burn to the finish, as well as a hint of cracker. Despite its alcoholic ripeness, it feels thin through the midpalate and should be consumed over the next couple of years.

title: Domaine Chopin et Fils 2015  Côtes de Nuits Villages
description: Attractive red-cherry perfumes give this wine immediate accessibility that is confirmed by the soft palette and sweet tannins. The wine is juicy, with just a light core of dryness and a red-cherry aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine des Crets 2015 Climat L'Echenault de Serre  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)
description: Rich and full of ripe fruit, this is a generous wine. Apricot and peach flavors are right up front, with great fruitiness as well as a tang of minerality. It is an opulent wine, full bodied and ready to drink.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2014 Bolton Vineyard Reserve Barbera (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: This is an interesting wine due to the rarity of Barbera in Oregon, but also because it has real varietal character. Dried leaves, tobacco and tanned leather notes highlight its soft plum and cherry flavors. There's a sweet, lightly chocolaty kick to the finish.

title: Château Bel-Orme Tronquoy de Lalande 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Associated with Château Rauzan-Gassies in Margaux, this is a surprisingly lean wine. Acidity comes from the red fruits and the wine is light. Red berries are just supported by tannins to suggest potential. Drink from 2020.

title: Château de Santenay 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)
description: This is a juicy wine, initially crisp then broadening out into ripe red fruits and some firm background tannins. It comes from the Côte Chalonnaise region, from an area known for accessible reds like this. Drink this fruity wine from 2019.

title: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's aroma brings light notes of honey, brown sugar and herb. The flavors are sweet and elegant. It's a light, pleasing affair.

title: 29 & Oak Wines 2016 Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
description: Light bodied, this charming combination of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot has an entry of cherry, vanilla and subtle char. Consistent and juicy on the midpalate, it has a taste of bark that provides a bite of bitterness on the finish.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an extracted, softly layered wine, generous on the palate in dark brooding cherry, blackberry and cassis. Additional elements lean richer and more concentrated, highlighted by chocolate, leather and tobacco.

title: Avensole 2014 South Slope Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: There are strong aromas of spearmint and licorice on the nose of this bottling, set against a background of black cherry and tangy strawberry. The sip is very energetic and chalky in structure, with flavors of tangy red fruit, licorice, bay leaf, milk chocolate and vanilla on the finish.

title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Mainly Pinot Noir with a touch of Gamay, this fruity wine is bright with acidity and crisp red-currant flavors. Its acidity and zesty character are enhanced by the lively mousse. Drink now.

title: Bergevin Lane 2013 Wild Child Merlot (Wahluke Slope)
description: Barrel aromas are at the fore in this wine, with vanilla and baking spice notes in front of plum. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors, and drying tannins provide the frame.

title: Birichino 2015 Muscat Canelli (Monterey)
description: Ripe aromas of Gravenstein apple, nectarine, Meyer lemon, red pears and orange blossoms show on the very approachable and pleasant nose of this dessert wine. It's quite sweet right away on the sip, full of apple, pear and viscous orange-blossom flavors, with just enough acidity.
